channel.title: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?
channel.description: Ive implemented both these systems for npc chats, and both seem to compile perfectly, however whenever I test it out it just does not work at all.. Ive checked to make sure everything is there.. what am i missing? im using moparclassic's build.xml so that the build shouldnt be the problem.. any suggestions?

item.title: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:7, topic:460298”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=563218.msg4105696#msg4105696 date=1347936524]

i have never seen a scala script so i can’t comment on that, but mine was made so the community could help out making scripts (which they did) it is very easy to use, but yeah it could be better, if i were to do it over again it would be in python.

also the implementation of beanshell that i did is bad, the scripts are not compiled they are just text interpreted on the fly, on their own thread. im surprised it worked as well as it did.
[/quote]https://github.com/Joe0/MoparClassic/tree/master/GameServer/src/org/moparscape/msc/gs/npchandler

is that still using the single thread with the abstract delayed events? if so looks very neat compared to it’s java version.[/quote]I don’t think so; I think it would be a bit messier by using lambdas and currying.

Read full topic
item.source: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?

item.title: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:6, topic:460298”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=563218.msg4105631#msg4105631 date=1347930645]
i have never seen a scala script so i can’t comment on that, but mine was made so the community could help out making scripts (which they did) it is very easy to use, but yeah it could be better, if i were to do it over again it would be in python.

also the implementation of beanshell that i did is bad, the scripts are not compiled they are just text interpreted on the fly, on their own thread. im surprised it worked as well as it did.
[/quote]https://github.com/Joe0/MoparClassic/tree/master/GameServer/src/org/moparscape/msc/gs/npchandler[/quote]
is that still using the single thread with the abstract delayed events? if so looks very neat compared to it’s java version.

Read full topic

[quote=“xEnt, post:5, topic:460298”]i have never seen a scala script so i can’t comment on that, but mine was made so the community could help out making scripts (which they did) it is very easy to use, but yeah it could be better, if i were to do it over again it would be in python.

also the implementation of beanshell that i did is bad, the scripts are not compiled they are just text interpreted on the fly, on their own thread. im surprised it worked as well as it did.[/quote]https://github.com/Joe0/MoparClassic/tree/master/GameServer/src/org/moparscape/msc/gs/npchandler

item.source: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?

item.title: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

i have never seen a scala script so i can’t comment on that, but mine was made so the community could help out making scripts (which they did) it is very easy to use, but yeah it could be better, if i were to do it over again it would be in python.

also the implementation of beanshell that i did is bad, the scripts are not compiled they are just text interpreted on the fly, on their own thread. im surprised it worked as well as it did.

Read full topic
item.source: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?

item.title: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Snemo, post:3, topic:460298”]im just gonna xfer all my data from my dq source over to moparclassic, im so done with trying to figure this crap out

also, why does joe0 prefer his scala method over xents? xents seems simpler and easier to handle[/quote]xEnts is garbage… IDK why he prefers it, but I prefer it because Scala is type safe, faster, more flexible, doesn’t need to be maintained, etc.

Also, I don’t see how it’s easier or simpler…

Read full topic

item.title: BSH npc chat system + Joe0's scala npc chat system not working?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Snemo, post:1, topic:460298”]Ive implemented both these systems for npc chats, and both seem to compile perfectly, however whenever I test it out it just does not work at all… Ive checked to make sure everything is there… what am i missing? im using moparclassic’s build.xml so that the build shouldnt be the problem… any suggestions?[/quote]You’d probably be better off opening an issue on the fork that you got the code from, that way, if is an actual problem if can be fixed. Or if it’s just difficult to get set up, documentation will be with that fork.

Read full topic
